Based on their salaries, how much 25-year-olds should have saved to maintain their standard of living
Note: This level of investment savings should generate enough income for the retiree to still live on 75% of their pre-retirement salary, when also factoring in Social Security. The Social Security payments are based on projections for someone making that income who retired at age 66 on July 1, 2019.
kiersten schmidt/grow Grow reporting, Social Security Administration
